message:
Hi I have this problem and wish if someone can give me some hints regarding the solution.

I have N data files where each file have 300-400k data points, I need to graph 10 files per html page using Dygraph java script library.

Dygraph is doing an excellent job but this is heavy processing for a web browser. Is there are a way to make the Server do the javascript processing and show the results in the browser, so the browser would be lighter ?

I have googled a lot but it seem no simple solution for this.

data.message: I thought about that, but couldn't find a way to have the script running on nodejs while showing the gui visualization in the browser, if you know of a tutorial or something similar, it would be great.
I think that you will try to find a way to generate the html on the server by code and then you will just render this HTML. This method is used for large-scale websites. I will try to find some links
I don't know about Dygraph. What kind of data is it? If it's map data, use mapserver to produce tiles and have the web page just download the tiles.
On the dygraph website they mention that they can handle millions of points.

@Ahmed Aboulenein it's not map data, it's x-y graph data.
@ Mohammad Tayseer it can handle a lot of data but 10 graphs where each graph is 400k points is too much for a browser, it takes around 10 sec to load the page.
